Subset a ggmatrix object

Source: R/ggpairs_getput.R
getPlot.Rd

Retrieves the ggplot object at the desired location.

getPlot(pm, i, j)

# S3 method for ggmatrix
[(pm, i, j, ...)

Arguments

pm

ggmatrix object to select from

i

row from the top

j

column from the left

...

ignored

See also

putPlot

Author

Barret Schloerke

Examples

# Small function to display plots only if it's interactive
p_ <- GGally::print_if_interactive

data(tips, package = "reshape")
plotMatrix2 <- ggpairs(tips[, 3:2], upper = list(combo = "denstrip"))
p_(plotMatrix2[1, 2])
#> `stat_bin()` using `bins = 30`. Pick better value with `binwidth`.
#> Warning: Removed 22 rows containing missing values (geom_bar).
